This place is a fast casual dining spot specializing in "healthy" food, right by the 16th St Mission BART station. I really love the menu offerings: lots of options for vegetarians and vegans, and very doable if you're eating low/slow-carb/paleo-esque/Whole 30. I also really appreciate that the vegan options were clearly marked! I wish there were *more* veg-friendly protein options; beans are a great start, but I'd love some eggs, faux meat like Beyond Sausage, or chickpea tofu.

The food itself was pretty tasty although just a touch on the bland side. I got the vegan Cuban bowl, and my husband got veggie tacos (a special) plus yucca chips.

The restaurant is a nicely designed, comfortable, clean place. It's one of those places you order at the counter and get a number, and they bring your order to your table. There were only two copies of the menu at the counter, so if you were waiting in line, you couldn't spend your time waiting deciding on what you were going to order. Staff also weren't doing a great job clearing tables, and patrons weren't busing their own tables. In addition, our food came out in a slow trickle. First, they brought out the yucca chips pretty quickly. Then, in a reasonable amount of time, they brought out my husband's taco. He had ordered queso they had on special to go with his taco, but it wasn't until they brought out the taco that we learned they had run out of queso. The server offered to bring aioli instead, which sounded good. But then it took another five-ten minutes for that to arrive, and my dinner was still missing. It eventually arrived, but my husband had almost finished eating by then.

Service issues aside, I'd give them another try. They also deliver via various services, which seems super convenient for a weeknight healthy dinner.
author: Sylvia C.

description: Delicious and healthy food that can be delivered anywhere in SF. Try the General Tso's chicken here it's excellent!
author: Phil K.

description: Really excellent food and a great option for low carb. I was worried it wouldn't be filling or the portions would be small but the portions were actually really big and I was stuffed after I ordered a bowl.
author: David C.

description: Clean delicious amazing food.  Everything I've had has been exceptional and perfect.  Thank you for being there Kitava
author: Dan D.

description: After 20 days on Whole30 it was a distinct treat to be able to walk into a restaurant and order straight from the menu with no substitutions, special requests, or worries. Just that probably would have earned three stars. The very friendly staff, clean, open, inviting space and kombucha would have added another star. But the actual food? So delicious. And for those of you a little suspicious of 'health food' - it was delicious by any standard. We tried the General Tso's chicken and sauce and the Cuban bowl (cauliflower rice in both cases instead of jasmine), plus got sides of plantains and Brussels sprouts. (Note that, despite my previous raving, not everything is Whole30 compliant (see those beans in the Cuban bowl?) so do be sure to actually read the menu.) Welcome to the neighborhood, Kitava!
author: Lori W.

description:
Amazing food high quality and made with love. Also very well priced. 

I got the spaghetti and tsao chicken it was amazing!!
author: A G.

description: This place is wonderful. It is very rare to find vegetarian restaurant options that are not cheese/carb heavy, or just plain boring. I work close by and eat here about once a week. The baja bowl (my go-to) is full of a variety of textures and flavors, and it feels like eating home-cooked food. The staff has always been very friendly. I HIGHLY recommend trying this place out!!
author: Audrey H.

description:
We ordered the General Tso chicken with cauliflower rice and broccoli. Food was
lukewarm at best when it arrived. The chicken was over cooked, dry and rubbery as well as bland. They put liquid aminos in a pool at the bottom of the container. We couldn't eat this food. If it's good for you it has to taste awful, right? We ordered from DoorDash and contacted their customer support. They offered us a $1.99 credit for next delivery-that's it. Needless to say very disappointing.
author: Maria T.

description: Fresh, solid lunch fare. It never disappoints. I wish they had more grain and legume options but I like what they have.
author: Anthony S.

description: Seriously amazing. This block needed an affordable healthy option SO bad and this fits the bill perfectly. I'm usually anti overly healthy vegany places, but this spot serves meat and doesn't take themselves too seriously. GET THE ZOODLES!
author: Corinne A.

description: Ordered general tsao chicken today for delivery as I was so hungry after work (I normally don't do takout). $15 for 6 tiny pieces of soggy chicken and undercooked broccoli over white rice. So overpriced! I was not impressed by the lack of seasoning other than a soy vinaigrette that was soaking at the bottom of the dish. While this restaurant seems like a good concept, I do not wish to try this place out again.
author: Logic M.

description:
*** edited - see below for original text ****

Yelp reviews don't really allow for interaction when the owner responds so I'm using this space to respond to the owner. 

1. It was never my intention to get your staff fired from my comment. I feel horrible about that and am sorry that you couldn't find a better resolution to the issue.   
2. I make a lot of chicken bone broth at home. That's not what I tasted on the meatloaf. It was an off flavor from within the meatloaf.  
3. I would prefer just salt and oil over your amino blend. Or just use soy sauce. Why would I want my vegetables sweet anyhow?
4. There is nothing wrong with msg - it's a massive socially propagated belief that it's bad. Do some research and look at some studies. Not a single double blinded study has found any problems with it. It's just an amino acid stabilized by a sodium ion (as found in salt). It's found naturally at high concentrations in so much stuff, like Parmesan.  If you want something salty, we add salt. If you want something with more umami, you add msg. 

Also, I spoke to one other guy who got the chicken. According to him it tasted like it was just boiled in water. Can you not use oil and sear meat with the paleo diet?  

****************************************

I had high expectations for this place.  Im doing a lot of low carb and was happy to find a place that had so many low carb options.  4 of us came here for lunch and had the meatloaf, general chows, chicken, and pulled pork bowls.  Meatloaf and accompanying sweet potatoes had such a strange off taste.  Bitterness and citrus and funk.  Meatloaf should taste like meat.  I have idea what it tasted like. The general chows was meh and only tolerable due to my friend not having had breaded chicken for a long time - but he says the cauliflower rice ruined it.  I tried some spit it out into a napkin. The pulled pork was so bland - but managed to be the best option because it lacked funky strange off flavors. 

To top it off, the person at the register pre-pressed the 20% tip button before showing is the payment screen. This is a no service establishment.  20% to take my order is just ridiculous.  

One of us (with the pork) said he might come back. Rest of us will not. I didn't eat more than two bites of the meatloaf and I'm off to the Taco Bell on duboce to get this nasty taste out of my mouth.
author: reza n.

description:
I'm waiting for my food at Kitava now. Literally nobody around me has their food. Everybody is waiting, and it seems like only one person works here. We had to find a dirty table and bus it because nobody is cleaning up.  No glasses for the self-serve water, no forks in the self-serve cutlery on each table. We stood in line waiting to order for about 10 minutes, now waiting for our food. I'll update once we eat, but at this rate it could be a while.  So far this is a hot mess.  They don't have their shit together yet. Maybe order to go, but don't dine in. Especially if you have plans. 

Update: I was served a good 5 minutes before my boyfriend was served. My Cuban bowl was delicious but my boyfriend's General Tso was dry and meh. The overall experience sucked, especially because the front door was constantly open since delivery guys were running in and out every minute and cold air was coming in the whole time.

Bill for two people ordering one dish each is $40.
author: Tamara S.

description:
This place is a paradise for clean-eaters. Even if you are not into that kind of thing the food is very delicious. For anyone that has dietary restrictions get here now. I've been saying we need a restaurant similar to Hu Kitchen in NYC. This is the place! 

I had one of the specials - a pork and plantain bowl - amazing slow cooked pork, perfectly sautéed plantains, a yummy verde type sauce and pico. They kindly swapped the rice and beans for extra plantains (noms). Also got a green iced tea, fudge brownie, and an order of the butternut squash hummus with yucca chips (yeah I had to try multiple things I was just do excited). All of that stuff was only around $25 (a good deal in my mind for everything I got).

Butternut squash hummus was unlike anything I've ever had. If they sold it I would buy the gallon size ;) 

My friend got the bone broth and avocado mash with yucca chips and couldn't stop raving about both. 

In short check them out or order one of their many delivery options - Caviar etc.
author: Jessica M.

description: Have no complaints! Bright and clean inside (in contrast to 16th St BART area...), and fair price for some relatively healthy food. I was worried that it wouldn't be flavorful because it was "healthy" but my dish was super packed with flavor!
author: J. A.

description: I've only had delivery. This is one of my favorite restaurants. Being plant based it provides me with options that are flavorful and filling.
author: Sheralyn F.

description: First time dining at Kitava and it was just about perfect. I love the fact that my friends and I could each eat anything on the menu we wanted (of the four of us one eats paleo, one vegetarian). I had the spaghetti squash bolognese and my friends had the cuban bowl (one vegan and one with pulled pork. We all loved everything. I came home and told my family and seriously i think we are going back tomorrow so they can try it! Thanks for being here and also for being mindful of the neighborhood and gentrification which a previous person mentioned in their post. There's a place in the bay view where customers can pay for a slice of pizza and they will give it to a person if need who comes in if they are hungry and can not pay. I wonder if that's  something you might consider? The way they do it: you pay for a slice and they place a sticky note in the window letting a person in need know there is a free slice waiting for them if they need it. When the stickies run out, people know there are none available. I would totally participate in that if you offered it. Just a thought.
author: Lisa E.

description: Delicious. Healthy. Creative menu. Nice decor. Love the live plants inside. Great staff.
author: Mj D.

description: Amazing fresh food and fast service! My sister and kids got the Cuban bowl (beans, rice (but not too much rice), plantains, veggies), I got a salmon salad (beautiful spinach, cabbage, romaine, nicely cooked salmon without being dry) and we shared Brussel sprouts (can't go wrong with fried sprouts). Everything was so good and the portions were huge!! I will definitely be going back there next time I'm in San Fran.
author: Kitty W.

description:
A new staple in the mission. We went with a small group of friends and shared a few appetizers and mains. Everything we had was delicious. Personal favorites were the Brussels sprouts for a starter and Zoodles with meatballs for the main. 

The place was also very inviting, as were the people working there. You could tell they care about making very tasty food using wholesome ingredients. 

I'll definitely be back.
author: Jeremy V.

description:
My health is a huge priority, and that starts with the food that I put in my body. San Francisco is a great place to find really healthy food, but Kitava has blown me away with their healthy and paleo options. Everything is tasty, and everything makes me feel good after I've eaten it.

I've spent time talking to the founders of the place, and their philosophy about food and health mirrors my own, which means I'm eating the same quality food that they'd put in their own bodies.

I also order their food delivery on GrubHub all the time. Sometimes you want takeout that's actually good for you. 

If you're looking for healthy fast casual food, try these guys out.
author: Austin G.

description:
I am hooked on delivery from Kitava! The portions are huge - enough to share for two. Every thing I have ordered has been flavorful and fresh - tastes home cooked. 

I especially enjoy the cuban bowl, pesto meatballs and the ice cream sandwich. 

Kitava Crew - thanks for all you do to prepare this food!
author: Kelsey D.

description:
Their Spaghetti Squash Bolognese (no wheat) - Wow! Incredible. I got it to go as I'd just finished a run their with Run Way/SF and when I got home I ate half as my midday meal. I've saved the rest for today.
Good vibes from the staff. I'll be a regular, so much on their menu is tempting.
author: Jack T.

description:
Finally a "paleo" place in San Francisco. 
I ordered just about everything off of the menu. Zero complaints about any of the dishes and sides. 

My favorite dish was the Cuban bowl (yummy pork goodness) and I really enjoyed the "pesto" meatballs. 

general tso's chicken was also amazing. Breaded with cassava flour (which is a prebiotic) served over a bed of cauliflower rice and broccoli with a side of coconut aminos. Delicious !! 

I definitely recommend this place!

5 Star food !
author: Alvaro C.

description: Second attempt. Waited in line. "Sorry, no Salmon today."
author: iko o.

description: Me and my wife went there in the evening. I don't wanna talk about the price and portion. Because it was ridiculously. We ordered a Cobb salad and salmon. The salad was ok, but the salmon is super dry like jerky!! I don't know if they preheat the salmon or they made a mistake and reheat the order. We also ordered side of Brussel sprout and it came in yellow color. The table right next to us ordered the same thing and it looks so green and fresh. WTF!! I will never come back again. Hopefully I m the only lucky one to get these kind of food for these price, thank you!
author: James F.

description:
Baja chicken Cuban Mojo Pork Spice toasted cauliflower and Jasmine rice is what I had on my plate for the night. 

For the place to be on 16th and Mission the other TL of SF it's a nice place.
author: Mychelle T.

description:
This is my go to lunch in the mission, it's healthy and tasty. I order from here at least once a week for lunches at work. Everyone at work is on a different type of diet and this place fits everyones needs. People go back to work happy and full.  The favorite in the office is General Tso's chicken with the cauliflower rice!

The restaurant its self is very clean which is a plus especially since it's in the mission.
author: Tiffany D.

description: Favorite spot, I stop by or order delivery at least once a week. A place focused on higher quality with a variety of offerings available.
author: Jaron H.

description: I'm so happy this place exists. Their paleo & whole 30 compliant dishes are delicious. My go-to is the spaghetti squash and bolognese sauce, though I've tried most items on the menu and have been pleased with everything. If you're not used to eating paleo or whole 30, the dishes likely won't taste like what you're expecting. For example, General Tso's chicken won't taste like the Chinese take out dish filled with msg and regret. Instead, it'll be a healthy meal that leaves you feeling energized and satisfied.
author: MP B.

description: I practice a paleo lifestyle and this place hits the spot! It's refreshing to see you can get grass fed beef and pasture raised meat without breaking the bank. The ginger kombucha is awesome!
author: Supreet C.

description: As I write this post, I'm currently on day 6 of Whole30. Today I searched for Whole30 compliant restaurants and Kitava appeared to be first on the list. My boyfriend and I decided to eat here for dinner and ordered a Cuban Bowl and Spaghetti Squash Bolognese. The staff were very accommodating to meet customers' needs, especially when they're on a diet like Whole30. Kudos to the staff and management for having a binder dedicated to all the listed ingredients of their menu. Whether you're on Whole30 or not, we were glad to be able to customize our own dishes with the compliant ingredients. As soon as we paid our order, we sat down on a table and did not expect to get our order in less than 5 minutes. Lastly, we were curious to find out about a yellow sauce in a bottle. I kindly asked the staff what it was and it was actually Whole30 Pineapple Habanero sauce with no added sugar. I immediately fell in love with this restaurant and would love to go back regardless of my future diet plans.
author: Gene A.

description: Just tried delivery from Kitava and was super impressed. Baja bowl with Pastured chicken, cauliflower rice, avocado salad all fresh and delicious. Delivery was prompt and professional (grubhub) and the restaurant called when receiving my order to see if spinach was ok to substitute for arugula (it was). That they run out of arugula in the evening means they keep their stuff fresh, which comes through in the taste. Based on this great meal, I will need to visit their brick and mortar spot. Thanks Kitava
author: Tom J.

description: I loved ordering from Mealmade, so of course I was super excited to see that they have a restaurant I can visit at least once a week!! I tried the General Tso's chicken with cauliflower rice, who needs rice when you have cauliflower rice...they totally need to sell this as a side!! I would eat this with all my Asian dishes!! The place is small, but the order delivery was rather quick. I can't wait to come back and order some other items off the menu. I do hope they bring the collards back, they were one of my favorites!
author: Korynne B.

description: By far one of the safest and most delicious places to eat for someone with food allergies and intolerances. I appreciate and respect their commitment to quality, nutrient-dense meals made from locally sourced and sustainable, organic ingredients. Great portion sizes, so you get that bang for your buck, and the space is cozy and inviting; it's come a long way since being a Mc Donalds. Do yourself a favor and get the General Tso's Chicken....you're welcome.
author: Araceli E.

description: Tastes great and also healthy? Win! I've had the general tso's chicken with cauliflower rice and the beef and pesto meatballs. Both were excellent. The decor inside is also a delightful retreat from the hustle and bustle of the mission.
author: dan s.

description: Very underwhelmed. Ingredient flavors did not go well together and seemed just thrown together in a bowl and called healthy
author: Jessica G.

description: Delicious food. Great vibe. Definitely coming back. Highly recommend the butternut squash hummus. Finish off with almond cookie vanilla gelato sando. So good!!
author: Nathan E.

description: This is hands down the most amazing food delivery I've found in San Fran. Me and my boyfriend use to only go to wholefoods hot bar but now we only order from here almost every night. They have gone above and beyond to accommodate my special request and the few times my order had some small mistakes they exceeded my expectations at correcting them and making things right. Finally delicious healthy food I can have delivered. Score.
author: Sarah M.

description: Have eaten here twice, once in the restaurant and another time getting takeout. Good dining out option if you have dietary restrictions; they use high quality ingredients and portions are generous. The downsides are slow/inefficient service, blandish flavor, and price ($18 for a chicken, slaw, & rice bowl). It's a nice addition to the neighborhood, but until they iron out the operational kinks I won't be adding them to my usual rotation.
author: Lulu C.

description: Excellent deliciousness! Clean and locally sourced, nutrient-dense fun and nice atmosphere to sit in the heart of the mission. Definitely recommend!
author: Ave L.

description:
We were so impressed with our dinner at Kitava! In addition to being made from scratch from high-quality and clean ingredients, everything we ate was so delicious!

We ordered the butternut squash hummus with yucca chips, crispy Brussels sprouts, the Cuban bowl with cauli rice and sunflower seed risotto, General Tso's chicken with cauli rice, and an almond flour cookie and dairy-free vanilla gelato for dessert.

Everything was great but our favorite things were probably:
- General Tso's chicken, which was crispy and perfect. All of the comfort of chicken nuggets without all of the unhealthy crap!
- Sunflower seed risotto -so tasty and such a great idea for a bean replacement that neither of us had ever thought of!
- Crispy brussels sprouts - now I know a lot of restaurants make something like this but often they're undercooked (no one wants raw brussles) and guarantee they're not using healthy fats to cook them like Kitava does.

- Vanilla bean gelato! It's amazing and you'd never know it's dairy-free (made with cashew milk). Even better it's also egg-free which is great for those of us with egg allergies.
- *Bonus: special shout out to the bottles of habanero pineapple hot sauce on each table which we wanted to take home with us (don't worry we didn't, although we made sure to add some extra to our togo boxes).

Eating out can be really difficult based on food sensitivities/allergies or the conscious choice to eat higher quality food and avoid industrial seed oils, commercial meats etc, but Kitava does a great job making going out to eat stress-free (besides trying to decide what to order because you want to get everything).

Go check them out! Or if you're in SF, have them deliver to you!
author: Rachael O.

description: Omg this place is amazing. The owners are sooo nice and the food is great. I'm a vegan and this spot is perfect for food. Many vegan options and great portion sizes. I had the roasted brassica salad - amazing.
author: Angela D.

description: To start, Kitava is one of my favorite gluten free restaurants in the city. I usually order their General Tso's chicken and maybe some bone-broth, both of which are gluten free. It's a little bit pricey but it has a good environment inside of the little restaurant. The location outside is crazy and loud, but inside, it's its own safe haven from the rain.
author: Summer B.

description: I'm a vegetarian/vegan and I love all the options that they have here. The food is extremely clean & fresh tasting! The options are healthy whether you're into meat or not! They base a lot of their menu mostly off of the islands of Papa New Guinea and do a great job at it! They also have two kombuchas on tap! This place is a gem!
author: Marty M.

description: Finally, a 100% Paleo restaurant! Everything was fantastic, flavorful, and our food came out QUICK. They've got a bunch of desserts (that we will try next time) and they've even got some booch on tap. Awesome place to go if you are Paleo, gluten-free, dairy free, or on a Whole30.
author: Summer L.

description: I am on the autoimmune protocol and this restaurant is just what I was looking for on my trip to San Fran. They have an AIP menu to make it easy for anyone on strict or modified AIP to pick what they can eat; they even host an AIP cooking class! I really wish there was a place like this in LA. Overall very satisfied with this restaurant!
author: jasmine g.

description: Not sure why SF never had a place like this before, I love Kitava! It's right off Bart and super convenient, the food is made with REAL ingredients and Paleo/Whole 30 friendly. The General Tso's Chicken was great as well as the Cuban Bowl with pork. I will definitely be going back. I have used yelp for 5+ years and never left a review. The food here is worth it.
author: John S.

description: Amazing food and great staff. The Brussels sprouts are to die for and the vegan Cuban plate is amazing. Definitely a great place to go to keep it healthy
author: Sabrina K.

description: Arrived on time. Bone broth was wonderful and the Kung Pau Chicken, plantains, and avocado salad were delicious. I'm happy I found this place. I've been under the weather and exactly what I needed.
author: Courtney S.

description: Great healthy eating options. We ordered food and they delivery was quick hassle free.
author: Tejal D.

description: Have ordered takeout from here 3 times now, and I have to say it's never blown me away. Bummed bc I was really hopeful about it given all the good reviews. The bolognese and the zoodles with meatballs were okay. The Baja Bowl (I got it with the adobe chicken and cauliflower rice), I'm sad to say, tasted like dog food. I've never been to the brick and mortar, which looks like a really nice space, so maybe the experience is better when you're actually there. For now though, I'm scratching this off my takeout list and will have to look elsewhere for healthy meals.
author: Brodie J.

description: This food fed my soul!!!! I came here with my vegan daughter, in paleo/whole30 and we were able to order our meals together and be compliant. I cannot stress have w fresh and delicious the food is. The bone broth was amazing. I cannot say enough good things about the food and customer service here. I'm from out of town but will def be here every time I am in town.
author: Marie B.

description: My favorite restaurant!  I have a bunch of allergies and this place has given me so many great choices!!  I love it.  Shout out to Virgil for great customer service and fun.  Favorite place in San Fran if not the world.
author: Marcus P.

description:
I've eaten hundreds of no-carb, low-carb, and paleo meals, so I was excited to see what the pros can do.

I tried a mix-and-match Brussels sprouts, chicken, and sweet potato mash bowl.

Brussels sprouts: They transported me back to the mid-80's whine-to-your-momma era of vegetables. If they were boiled or steamed, just close your restaurant please. If they were roasted, do it about twice as long, in a single layer, and consider a little salt, pepper, oil, and if you're feeling fancy a small splash of balsamic vinegar.

Chicken: It was a bare pale chicken breast with that odd slightly rubbery wetness that boiled (perhaps you'd call it poached?) chicken has. Not much else to say because what else is there to say about a boiled chicken breast, the next-blandest protein to tofu? Consider roasting or searing these in a pan, sprinkle on some herbs, and possibly switch to chicken thighs for more (any) flavor and texture. There was a dipping bowl with about 1 tablespoon of lemon juice and herbs that helped a small amount. If you serve chicken and it's less flavorful than what you can get every day at Chipotle, there is work to do.

Sweet potato mash: I love sweet potatoes. Over the hundreds of times I've eaten sweet potatoes and yams in my life (in every way, mashed, pan-roasted, fries, etc), this was the first time I didn't eat the whole serving. The best way to describe Kitava's sweet potatoes would be sour potatoes. They're already tangy if you're not adding sugar, so I see very little reason to put in so much lemon juice. Disappointing, sour, and gloppy. Try dicing them and boiling or pan-roasting with SMALL amount of lemon juice in the water to keep them intact, then lightly tossing with an herbed aioli and chives for a lower-carb spin on potato salad. Or slice up some wedges and roast those in oil, and serve with chipotle mayo. Or, just mash them and do as little to them as you can...sweet potatoes are great without any additions or seasoning. Let the taste come through without piling on stuff that sounds cool on the menu.

All ingredients together: There was no problem with the quality of the ingredients, just the preparation. But if you're a grocery store you can get by on just the quality of ingredients; as a restaurant the preparation is the majority of what you bring to the table. The bowl was served a couple degrees above room temperature. Not sure if that was intentional but it didn't help the textures and flavors at all. All-in cost for a bowl+tax and free water was about $20.
author: Garrett M.

description: Tried the Cuban bowl. Pretty tasty. Would go back for lunch or for dinner to go. Good service and energy.
author: Natalia D.

description: This is a great restaurant, they serve meet substitutes, aswell as free range meats,  very good diversity in their cuisine from general tzo chicken to Cuban bowls! Delicious
author: Jerry W.

description: So good. Loved the Brussels sprouts, Cuban, tsao chicken. All of it was very tasty. As a person who is not worried about gf and all the other dietary boxes this place checks I loved it. Smelled amazing right when you walked in. It's amazing the space used to be a McDonalds.
author: Matthew B.

description:
This place is outstanding. 

I am quite particular when it comes to going out. Often times, I'd rather eat at home vs eating out to avoid the way my body feels after food has been cooked in cheap oils or cross contaminated. Kitava in next level when it comes both to taste and integrity. 

You can feel the love they put into their menu and food as your body is filled and feels amazing afterward. 

Not only is this food amazing, it's also at a price that doesn't break the bank. Not to mention the fact it was in an old Mc Donalds is fantastic! 

Whoever dreamed up this place had health in mind. Thank you for making your vision become a reality that many can enjoy!
author: Amanda B.

description: Love this place. The food is more in the 3.5-4 Star, BUT it's so damned healthy that it gets a 5. Reasonable prices, quick food, nice staff.
author: Aaron A.

description:
Went here with a friend who has a gluten intolerance over the weekend. We both ordered variations of the Cuban Bowl and were not only satisfied with the balanced portions of the meal, the tenderness of the pork was out of this world sort of melt in your mouth goodness.  

Also really digged the decor and plan on coming back now that I know it's so close to BART. This place is ideal for lunch dates if you're commuting!  I highly recommend!
author: Peter N.

description: Ordered the Roasted Broccoli with Lemons & the Brassica Salad with Salmon. It was okay. I ordered it through DoorDash so I understand the food wouldn't be super hot. The broccolis were a bit burnt and over cooked. The salad was fine, nothing real special. Overall, everything I tried was decent. I'd like to try out their different meals though.
author: Kristin Y.

description: It's amazing to find restaurants that cater to people with food restrictions. Their Brussels sprouts is amazing and also the Baja bowl. You end up feeling good about yourself and also your taste buds thank you.
author: Yamini S.

description:
I'm so happy this place exists! I keep wanting to pinch myself because it seems too good to be true: a beautiful, serene oasis, conveniently located across from the 16th and Mission BART station, with friendly & fast service, wifi -- and most importantly, food that somehow manages to be indulgently delicious while still being healthy.

So far I've loved every dish I've tried:
1. Zoodles & meatballs: Perfectly done zoodles, still slightly crunchy but tender enough to twirl around your fork like pasta, covered in a fresh tomato sauce, and four huge meatballs. I was especially impressed with the meatballs, they were so moist and full of flavor.
2. Fried plantains: Fried in just enough oil to make them soft and caramelized, but not at all greasy (which is my typical complaint about plantains). They come with a slightly spicy mayo dipping sauce that's the perfect complement to the plantains' sweetness.
3. Cauliflower rice: Excellent, rice-sized "grains" that somehow don't taste like cauliflower at all. A fluffy and healthy side dish that pairs well with a bunch of different things (I tried it with meatballs + tomato sauce, and also with the plantains + mayo).

The portions are all really generous, btw. I can tell I'll be a regular here for a long time, especially since it's a spot I can bring my vegan friends, paleo friends, and foodie friends alike.
author: Anne P.

description:
Ordered from Mealmade / Kitava several times and didn't have an issue. Food tastes pretty good for being paleo-friendly. However, most recent lunch order messed up three of the entrees by not adding additional items (i.e. extra chicken, meat sauce instead of veggie sauce, etc) that were paid for. 

During busy hours, be sure to check your orders to make sure you actually got what you ordered.
author: Daffy D.

description: UPDATE: I went back again today, and this place deserves five stars.  The service was honest and the food was great.
author: Ashley K.

description: Looking for tasty filling food that doesn't leave you with lots of guilt - look no further. While healthy fast food is the concept, you wouldn't know it to look at it. Portions are large, tasty and filled with cool flavorful twists. Pro tip: their sauces are to die for! I wandered in one day and had my food 15 minutes later -- and it was still warm by the time I came home. If anything, my one critique is that there's no tasting menu as so much looks exciting.
author: Zara S.

description: The food is delicious! The prices are good. And the staff is chill. I'm on the autoimmune protocol diet (AIP) so it's amazing to be able to eat everything on the menu. It's also great when eating with mixed diets like vegetarians/vegans and meat lovers.
author: Christina C.

description: Omg this place was AMAZING. As soon as I walked in, I was greeted by the kindest hostess. She recommended some dishes and I decided on the spaghetti squash bolognese. It was a quick, healthy, delicious dinner. I can't wait to return and try all everything else on the menu.
author: Sinead T.

description:
If you don't regularly eat as clean as the food served here, it's not going to taste the same. It takes time to adjust and detox from the overly processed "food" of the typical standard American diet. 

Okay, that said- this place rocks! Having a place that is gluten, dairy, soy, peanut and refined sugar/oil free means I will be safe and not feel sick after-food taste aside. That's already awesome. 

The general tso's chicken was delicious. Loved the sauce and the chicken was fried perfectly. The spaghetti squash bolognese was warm and comforting. 

I was impressed by the range of options they have- being able to accommodate vegans and paleo folks alike is not an easy thing. Bigger portions than I expected (the bowls are bigger than they look in the pictures!)

Will definitely come back. Wish they had a location in Marin!
author: Alana N.

description: I was so excited to find this place and they did not disappoint! This is exactly what SF needed! I have a very strict diet and it felt awesome to be able to actually have choices and go out to eat. The flavors were rich and yummy. I will definitely be back and will bring friends!
author: Jessa T.

description: I really enjoyed the food I had at Kitava. I tried the butternut squash hummus, crispy brussel sprouts and the vanilla bean gelato. The hummus was flavorful and lightly sweet. The brussel sprouts were crispy and delicious, served with aoli that was the perfect compliment. The gelato was tasty and apparently vegan. All around good experience, I look forward to coming back!
author: Cindy M.

description: Kitava!! This is my go-to spot for healthy, clean food. Their focus on traditional cultures and sustainability is a huge plus too. Recommend to all who are looking to start off this new year right.
author: Tręvõr L.

description: Just had the general tso chicken and it was the bomb! Highly recommend trying kitava - decent price too!
author: James H.

description: If I could give them more stars I would! The food options were amazing. I'm allergic to gluten/dairy/soy/eggs and I could easily review my many, many options (yay AIP menu!). General Tso's Chicken was fabulous. Service was equally amazing - everyone was super friendly.
author: Joslyn M.

description: I think I need to give this another shot, as I realize they just opened. I love  the concept and the story, however the food was VERY salty. I tried the Baja Bowl, and I would recommend a lot less salt. The flavors and seasonings of the Chicken are rich enough, no need to add salt to everything else. If you are serving fresh beautiful, good quality food, less is more when it comes to salt.
author: K D.

description: Excellent, healthy and delicious options in the Mission. Squash spaghetti with meatballs was perfect.
author: Chris M.

description:
Kitava is a great addition to the mission. Great healthy options with a convenient location. 

I got the broccoli, sweet potato, and salmon bowl. It was good portions. We also got the side of Brussels sprouts which were awesome.
author: Jason E.

description: OMG, I think I just found my new favorite restaurant! This place is AMAZING.  The food is consistently good.  Tonight I had the cuban bowl with plantains and butternut squash hummus--so DELICIOUS! I'm already planning on making a return trip sometime this weekend for the street tacos.  The food is fresh, doesn't have all kinds of sh*t in it and the flavors are AMAZING.  I'm vegan and find several options each time I get take-out from this place.  Check it out you'll be glad you did!
author: James E.

description: This place has great food including salads.  A healthier option.
author: a f.

description: Finally a great restaurant for Paleo / Keto people. Really good food, great ambience, and the delivery is okay too. Price is fine.
author: Brayden M.

description: This is my favorite, guilt free place to eat in San Francisco. The menu is crafted with human health, sustainable environmentalism, and affordability all top of mind. I go as often as I can!
author: J.B. B.

description: Upon entering the restaurant we were greeted by friendly staff who were educated on our dietary concerns. The smell of delicious food in the air, and a bounty of options I knew I was in the right place. I ordered the Cuban bowl (made by Ben!) which tasted as good as it looks.  fresh ingredients that are organic, AND pasture raised pulled pork! I was in heaven. I left feeling satisfied and energized. Will definitely be back for the general tso chicken :) and more
author: Zelda S.

description:
If I had to describe my meal at Kitava, it would sound something like this: extremely flavorful and downright delicious. 

I got the Baja Bowl with Cauliflower Rice and Sunflower Risotto. I had never had Sunflower Risotto so didn't know what to expect. Like I said, it was delicious. The bowl was filled with hearty goodness. I also got the Butternut Squash Hummus with plantain chips. Another dish that was unique, and extra tasty!  

The guys at Kitava are working hard to make sure their food is healthy, fresh, and follows guidelines of some complex diets, all without compromising taste. What more could you want? I already can't wait to go back!
author: Andi S.

description: This place has great tasting fast casual. And it is healthy! Plenty of options for vegan, vegetarian, and Paleo.
author: Ben L.

description: Cute place. The food was good as was the service. I felt that the food could be a little more flavorful, but it wasn't bad. I wasn't super impressed with the ice cream sandwich. Overall it is a nice place and I love that the food is all fresh and local.
author: Aya O.

description: Yum yum yum yum yum. 5yum review. Who knew paleo was so delicious. The transition of McDonalds to this wasn't lost on me. Out with the old, in with the yum and a better way of consumption. The menu was frustrating...because we couldn't decide what to order because everything tasted so good. It's both a restaurant and community for people who love good food and each other. See you here!
author: Brad W.

description: Love what Jeff and the rest of the team are doing at Kitava. Pastured meat, expertly-prepared veggies, inventive combos. Apparently the team has used the data collected during the meal-delivery era to craft a menu of favorite dishes. I'll be headed there tonight, can't wait to get another helping of the Brussels sprouts!
author: Rachel B.

description: I wanted healthy food that's also awesome and that's 100% what I got. Kitava is awesome! General Tso's Chicken, avocado salad and my friends shared roasted Brussels sprouts. Totally coming back... probably after yoga at Yoga To The People.
author: Christopher W.

description: The spaghetti squash Bolognese is so yummy. Nothing like healthier comfort food on a rainy day!
author: Mi M.

description:
I've only ordered takeout from here so I can't speak to the dine-in experience. The first few times I was pretty happy-- it's a little on the pricier side but the food is healthy and pretty creative. 

Sadly all good things come to an end. The one star is because it's currently 1am, and I'm up sick with food poisoning from the dinner I ordered (the coconut masala bowl).
author: S K.

description:
Soooooo good!!

I loved the General Taos Chicken, and the pork bowl (especially with that habanero salsa). For side dishes, the Yuca chips were really crispy and good and the pesto meatballs were perfectly cooked and had tons of tasty pesto.

Of course this place checks all the boxes for healthy eating (especially no seed oils!!), but it just tastes damn good and is normally priced. Why did it take SF so long to get a place like this?
author: Josh H.

description: Had the Cuba bowl with cauliflower rice and pork shoulder. It was really good. Very filling as well
author: J D.

description: I have Hashimoto's and I am on the AutoImmune protocol (gluten, dairy, soy, corn, dairy free). I can't eat in a lot of places in the city. Kitava's not only had an amazing menu that I can eat a lot from but their meatballs, salad, and yuca chips was the best meal I've had in a long time. So happy to have discovered this restaurant, it will now become part of my weekly menu :)
author: Ilya V.

description:
Kitava is the only delivery service (and soon to be restaurant as well) that I use/will go to without any questions asked. Their food is delicious. The cuisine seems to have an international hint across the world. 

My only complaint is they aren't everywhere at any time ! :)
author: Erich L.

description: Kitava has excellent food but I can't help but notice that it's out of place in the core cultural distinct latino culture of the mission and more in line with attracting more predominantly hip health consciouse people with high paying jobs.  I don't really want to bring gentrification here, but it is what it is.  If this place did not have excellent food I'd give this place a total thumbs down. I pass by this place a lot - and it's so out of place - I have not since one seen a latino family dine here.  I ate here and paid 5 bucks for clear organic broth. I appreciate the health conscious food menu, I do.  I do not appreciate how hip businesses  attracts the wrong kind of crowd which inevitably can potentially destroy a neighborhood without them consciously knowing it unless they do something about it and build relationships with their neighbors.  This is all over the mission.
author: Shu K.

description: I've eaten there three times now.... on average a 'bowl' costs $15..... even more if you replace normal rice with cauliflower rice or something of that sort. If the food was out of this world then I wouldn't complain about the price because the Mission needs some health food options that doesn't involve green juice! But in all honesty, as healthy-ish as the food is here, it's bland. They give you some sauces for your meals but if you add those then you mind as well have just gone to a local hole in the wall place and paid $8 for something super tasty, salty, and loaded with sugar.
author: Laura D.

description: Amending an earlier review- Always had positive things to say about the food here, but I left a  comment about a staff member being rude. I promptly received an apology which was appreciated. Thanks for being receptive to my feedback Kitava :)
author: Chris A.

description: Amazing meatloaf and great vibe. Used to be a McDonalds.. what an upgrade for 16th/Mission. I hear the General Tsao chicken is 10/10, I'll be back to try that soon.
author: Michael A.

description: This place had amazing food, ambiance, and service. The flavors and menu items they have are awesome. They're menu is completely gluten free which is so nice. Having celiacs can make eating out a real hassle. It was great to not have to think about the food or how to special order something. They also have vegan options.
author: Kelsee S.

description: Great gluten free, clean & tasty food.  I got the General chicken and the Cuban bowl. Both super you,  I have celiac disease and feel fine after eating here.
author: Banana G.

description: Excellent food, nice casual atmosphere.  The crispy b-sprouts were delicious!  Highly recommend the Cuban bowl.  Topped it off with gelato made from cashew milk.  All.very yummy.  Highly recommend
author: Susan W.

description: Healthy and tasty goodness at a reasonable price! It amazes me how few places like this are in SF. Brussels sprouts are to die for, meatloaf better than your mom's, and the sweet potatoes were excellent. I was starving and left with a smile. What a welcome addition to the Mission!
author: Rachel B.

description: The food is delicious. Apparently it is super healthy, but I really loved the meat and vegetables. Their guac is superb and the Cuban bowl perfectly balanced. And the brussel sprouts are perfect.
author: Rob R.
